ca.cgjennings.spelling

Class SpellingChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.cgjennings.spelling.SpellingChecker

  • public class SpellingChecker
extends Object
    Provides basic spelling checking services. The checker's dictionary is made up of one or more SpellingLists. The checker is itself a SpellingList. Words added directly to the checker are added to the main dictionary. The main dictionary is normally used to contain a fixed master dictionary and is initialized by reading content from a file. Other word lists are also available by calling appropriate methods: a user dictionary (user-supplied words that are normally serialized at shutdown), an ignore list (user-supplied words that are not serialized and last for the current session only), and a misspelling list (a list of commonly misspelled words used to improve the ranking of suggestions).

    The checker is liberal in its definition of what constitutes a word, and any arbitrary string may be added to its dictionary. However, the checker uses a WordPolicy which allows classes of words that can be described algorithmically to be accepted or rejected without having to place each word in the dictionary. The default policy is intended for use with natural language text and will vary with the locale. For more general use, you may wish to install the NullPolicy.

        public boolean adjustSuggestionCapitalization(String word,
                                              String[] suggestions)
        This utility method adjusts the capitalization of a number of possible replacements to match a word that might be replaced.
        Parameters:
        word - the original word
        suggestions - the possible replacements
        Returns:
        true if the word uses mixed case

      • getSharedInstance

        public static SpellingChecker getSharedInstance()
        Return a SpellingChecker that can be shared across an application. The checker will be a standard checker that uses the default locale unless setSharedInstance(ca.cgjennings.spelling.SpellingChecker) was used to specialize it.
        Returns:
        the shared checker

      • hideAll

        public void hideAll(WordList wl)
        Adds a collection of words from a word list to the list of hidden words.
        Parameters:
        wl - the list of words to add

      • hideWord

        public void hideWord(String word)
        Adds a word to the hidden list if it is not currently considered correct by the spelling checker. Words on this list are considered correct but never appear in a list of suggestions. This can be used to store correct but potentially offensive words. (Note that words on this list may still be suggested if they appear in another list.)
        Parameters:
        word - the word to hide

      • ignoreAll

        public void ignoreAll(WordList wl)
        Adds a collection of words from a word list to the table of words to ignore. This can be used to add context-specific words to the checker without having to modify the standard dictionary files. An event will be fired for each word added.
        Parameters:
        wl - the list of words to add

      • ignoreWord

        public void ignoreWord(String word)
        Adds a word to the ignore list if it is not currently considered correct by the spelling checker.
        Parameters:
        word - the word to ignore

      • installDefaultDictionary

        public void installDefaultDictionary()
                              throws IOException
        Install a default dictionary based on a locale. The term dictionary refers to a related set of word lists that together provide support for a language. The word lists must be located in the dict package and they must use names of the form main_XX.3tree and hidden_XX.3tree, where XX identifies the locale. (.cpl files may also be used.)
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while loading the lists

      • installDefaultPolicy

        public void installDefaultPolicy()
        Installs a default policy based on the current locale.

        If a policy class with the name ca.cgjennings.spelling.Policy_XX is found, where XX is the language code of the the locale, then a PolicyChain that chains an instance of BasicPolicy to that policy is created. Otherwise, a BasicPolicy is used.

        Throws:
        AssertionError - if a locale-specific class exists but it is not a WordPolicy or cannot be instantiated.

      • isCorrect

        public boolean isCorrect(String word)
        Return true if word is spelled correctly.
        Parameters:
        word - the word to check
        Returns:
        true if the word is correctly spelled

      • learnWord

        public void learnWord(String word)
        Adds a word to the user dictionary. Words in the user dictionary are equivalent to words in the main dictionary. They are considered correct and may appear in the list of suggestions. In addition, the user dictionary can be serialized so that the user's custom word set is maintained between runs of an application.
        Parameters:
        word - the word to add to the user dictionary

      • lookForWord

        protected final boolean lookForWord(String word)
        Try to locate a word, without any modification. Looks for the word in the main, user, hidden, and ignore dictionaries and returns true if it is found in any of them.
        Parameters:
        word - the word to look up
        Returns:
        true if the word is in a dictionary

      • setPolicy

        public void setPolicy(WordPolicy policy)
        Set the WordPolicy for this checker. The policy cannot be null, but the class NullPolicy may be used to effectively remove the policy.
        Parameters:
        basicPolicy - the new basicPolicy to be used
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if basicPolicy is null

      • setSharedInstance

        public static void setSharedInstance(SpellingChecker shared)
        Set the shared instance that will be returned by future calls to getSharedInstance(). The shared instance can only be set once. If a specialized checker is required, it must be set prior to any calls to getSharedInstance.
        Parameters:
        shared - the instance to share
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the instance is already set or getSharedInstance has been called
